greeting: Greetings from The On-Line Encyclopedia of Integer Sequences! http://oeis.org/

results.name: Number of 2's in ternary representation of n.
comment: Fixed point of the morphism: 0 ->001; 1 ->112; 2 ->223; 3 ->334, etc., starting from a(0)=0. - _Philippe Deléham_, Oct 26 2011
link: Reinhard Zumkeller, Table of n, a(n) for n = 0..10000
F. T. Adams-Watters, F. Ruskey, Generating Functions for the Digital Sum and Other Digit Counting Sequences, JIS 12 (2009) 09.5.6.
formula: a(n) = floor(n/2) if n < 3, otherwise a(floor(n/3)) + floor((n mod 3)/2).
mathematica: Nest[ Flatten[# /. a_Integer -> {a, a, a + 1}] &, {0}, 5] (* _Robert G. Wilson v_, May 20 2014 *)
program: a081603 n = a081603 n' + m `div` 2 where (n',m) = divMod n 3
results.author: _Reinhard Zumkeller_, Mar 23 2003
